cards.name: Academy Assessor
cards.text: After a player chooses two or more modes while casting a spell, you may pick one of those modes. That mode is no longer chosen. (That player doesn't pick targets or pay costs related to that mode. If a mode is chosen multiple times, only one instance of that mode is lost.)

cards.name: Alchemical Reserve
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
Tap three differently named untapped Academies you control: Put a +1/+1 counter on target permanent. Activate only as a sorcery.

cards.name: Almgrove Bladesinger
cards.text:
Whenever Almgrove Bladesinger attacks, harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Almgrove Ensemble
cards.text:
Lifelink
Whenever you cast a spell, harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Almgrove Ensemble deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.

cards.name: Almgrove Performer
cards.text:
When Almgrove Performer enters, harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Almgrove Spellblade
cards.text:
Whenever Almgrove Spellblade attacks, harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Exile the top two cards of your library. Until end of turn, you may play cards exiled by Almgrove Spellblade.

cards.name: Ardy, Indecisive Pupil
cards.text:
[+1]: Search your library for a land card, put it onto the battlefield, untap it, then shuffle. Sacrifice a land.
[-2]: Destroy target noncreature permanent. Its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
[-6]: Return any number of land cards from your graveyard to the battlefield and untap them. They become 3/3 creatures with haste in addition to their other types.

cards.name: Arpechian Architect
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}.
{1}{G}, {T}: Return target land card from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Arpechian Bellowers
cards.text:
Trample
When Arpechian Bellowers enters, harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Search your library for a green creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.name: Arpechian Conjurer
cards.text:
Lands you control have hexproof.
{2}{G}{U}: Rouse 2. (Distribute two +1/+1 counters among permanents you control. If they aren't creatures, tap them and they become 0/0 creatures in addition to their other types.)

cards.name: Arpechian Groundskeeper
cards.text:
When Arpechian Groundskeeper enters, rouse 1. (Put a +1/+1 counter on a permanent you control. If it isn't a creature, tap it and it becomes a 0/0 creature in addition to its other types.)
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Arpechian Groundskeeper: Draw a card.

cards.name: Arpechian Stag
cards.text: When Arpechian Stag enters, create a 3/3 red Elk creature token with haste, a 3/3 green Elk creature token with trample, and a 3/3 white Elk creature token with vigilance.

cards.name: Astrology Sanctum
cards.text:
Archive 3 (As this enters, shuffle the top three cards of your main library into a new face up library. Sacrifice this after the archived library is empty.)
Whenever you draw a card from the archived library, put the top card of your main library on the bottom of the archived library.
{R}: Exchange a card from the archived library with a card from your hand.

cards.name: Autumnal Resonants
cards.text:
When Autumnal Resonants enters, harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Create a 3/3 red and green Elemental creature token with haste.

changes: 2024-04-05 — Can now only exile permanents you don't control.
cards.name: Banishing Initiate
cards.text:
When Banishing Initiate enters, you may exile target nonland permanent you don't control until Banishing Initiate leaves the battlefield.
At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice Banishing Initiate if a card exiled with it has mana value 3 or greater.

cards.flavor: “If it's not perfect, then it's not finished.”
cards.name: Bestower of Blooms
cards.text: When Bestower of Blooms dies, create an X/X green Plant Knight creature token, where X is Bestower of Blooms's power.

cards.name: Break Their Guard
cards.text: Rouse 2. Target permanent gains trample until end of turn if it's a creature. (Distribute two +1/+1 counters among permanents you control. If they aren't creatures, tap them and they become 0/0 creatures in addition to their other types.)

cards.flavor: “No no no. You've filled out page seven incorrectly. It will all have to be done again.”
cards.name: Bureaucratic Dues
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. Each player shuffles their graveyard into their library.

cards.name: Calming Sanctum
cards.text:
Archive 3 (As this enters, shuffle the top three cards of your main library into a new face up library. Sacrifice this after the archived library is empty.)
Whenever you draw a card from the archived library, put the top card of your main library on the bottom of the archived library.
{G}: Exchange a card from the archived library with a card from your hand.

cards.name: Capture Brilliance
cards.text:
Choose two or four —
• Each player draws seven cards.
• Each opponent discards four cards.
• Conjure three cards named Fatigue and put them on top of your library. (They're colorless sorceries that cost {2} with “Draw a card.”)
• You may cast a card from your hand without paying its mana cost. Exile Capture Brilliance.

cards.name: Challenging Pupil
cards.text:
Haste
When Challenging Pupil enters, conjure a card named Fatigue and put it on top of your library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)

cards.name: Chaotic Pupil
cards.text:
When Chaotic Pupil enters, harmonize twice. (To harmonize, trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Charcoal Claws
cards.text: Rouse 1. Target permanent gains first strike until end of turn if it's a creature. (Put a +1/+1 counter on a permanent you control. If it isn't a creature, tap it and it becomes a 0/0 creature in addition to its other types.)

cards.flavor:
“What is the lifespan of the written word? A moment? A day? A year? In a master's hands, a single word can last a lifetime.”
— Rahit, arcane tutor
cards.name: Chronotome
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target player mills two cards. If your main library has five or fewer cards in it, that player mills their library instead.

cards.flavor: “I didn't lose it. Give me five, maybe twenty minutes.”
cards.name: Cluttered Study
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Draw a card, then exile a card from your hand face down until Cluttered Study leaves the battlefield. (It returns to your hand.)
{3}, {T}: Shuffle Cluttered Study into its owner's library.

cards.flavor: “Not quite my tempo.”
cards.name: Cocky Bladesinger
cards.text:
Flash
When Cocky Bladesinger enters, it gains first strike, lifelink, and haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: “What are they going to do? Give me more detentions to skip?”
cards.name: Cocky Delinquent
cards.text: Whenever Cocky Delinquent is dealt damage, you gain that much life and Cocky Delinquent deals that much damage to up to one target creature or planeswalker you don't control.

cards.name: Coerced Tutelage
cards.text: For each permanent type, choose up to one target permanent of that type. Exile each of those permanents, then return them to the battlefield under your control. They gain haste until end of turn. At the beginning of your next end step, those permanents' owners gain control of them.

cards.name: Combustion Display
cards.text: Exile the top two cards of your library. You may play those cards until the end of your next turn. Whenever you play one of those cards, rouse 1. (Put a +1/+1 counter on a permanent you control. If it isn't a creature, tap it and it becomes a 0/0 creature in addition to its other types.)

cards.name: Compose from Dreams
cards.text:
When Compose from Dreams enters, you may cast any number of cards named Fatigue from your hand and graveyard without paying their mana costs.
Whenever you cast a spell, each opponent loses 1 life. Then you may draw a card if that spell wasn't cast from your hand. Then add {U}{B}{R} if you don't own that spell.

cards.flavor: “Is it important? I'm a bit busy with this.” Dayang glanced up at Ardy, and her tone turned faintly hopeful. “Is it important?”
cards.name: Compulsory Studies
cards.text: When Compulsory Studies enters, exile target creature until Compulsory Studies leaves the battlefield. Each player draws a card.

cards.flavor: “Anyway, here's Wander's Call.”
cards.name: Confident Amateur
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, you lose 1 life and rouse 1. (Put a +1/+1 counter on a permanent you control. If it isn't a creature, tap it and it becomes a 0/0 creature in addition to its other types.)

cards.name: Counting Clouds
cards.text: Reveal the top five cards of your library. For each card type, you may put a card of that type revealed this way into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard. Then you may cast a nonland card with mana value 3 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor:
“Commit, Ardy. To anything. I'm done hanging around while you wait for the world to happen to you.”
— Dayang
cards.name: Craft Malice
cards.text: For each creature you control, create a token that's a copy of it. They gain haste. Sacrifice them at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Curated Citations
cards.text:
If an opponent would draw one or more cards, that player instead draws that many cards plus one, then exiles a card from their hand.
You may play cards exiled by Curated Citations, and you may spend mana as though it was mana of any type to cast them.

cards.name: Dance of Steel and Song
cards.text:
When Dance of Steel and Song enters, rouse 2. (Distribute two +1/+1 counters among permanents you control. If they aren't creatures, tap them and they become 0/0 creatures in addition to their other types.)
Artifact creatures and enchantment creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Dayang, Aspiring Muse
cards.text:
Lifelink
At the beginning of each player's end step, that player discards each card in their hand, then draws that many cards. When no cards are discarded this way, Dayang, Aspiring Muse deals 2 damage to each opponent.

cards.name: Dayang's Artistry
cards.text:
Whenever you draw a card, choose one —
• Dayang's Artistry deals 1 damage to any target.
• You gain 1 life.
• Scry 1.

cards.name: Dayang's Displeasure
cards.text:
Choose two or four —
• Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
• Each player sacrifices a creature.
• Each player sacrifices a noncreature, nonland permanent.
• Conjure a card named Fatigue and put it on top of your library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)

changes: 2024-10-01 — Was {R} Sorcery, Discard your hand, then draw two cards. Conjure a Fatigue.
cards.name: Daydream
cards.text:
Target instant or sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. Its flashback cost is equal to its mana cost reduced by {2}.
Conjure a card named Fatigue and put it on top of your library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)

cards.name: Demanding Pupil
cards.text:
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Spells your opponents cast cost an additional 2 life to cast until your next turn.

cards.name: Distilled Inspiration
cards.text:
When Distilled Inspiration enters, draw a card, then choose a card name.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.
{T}: Add one mana of any color. Spend this mana only to cast a spell with the chosen name or activate an ability of a card with the chosen name.

cards.flavor:
“Am I boring you?”
— Professor Shayle, to Ardy and Dayang
cards.name: Distract
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target creature or planeswalker spell.
• Return target creature or planeswalker to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Dream Keeper
cards.text:
When Dream Keeper enters, each player conjures a card named Fatigue and puts it on top of their library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)
Whenever a player draws a card except the first one they draw in each of their draw steps, each opponent mills a card.

cards.flavor: “To the left are the doors to Professor Shayle's classroom and to the counselors offices. Placed next to each other for no reason in particular.”
cards.name: Eager Guide
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Eager Guide attacks, tap up to two target creatures you don't control.

cards.name: Earthcraft Meditation
cards.text:
When Earthcraft Meditation enters, put three +1/+1 counters on each land you control.
At the beginning of combat on each player's turn, you may have any number of lands you control become 0/0 creatures with haste in addition to their other types until end of turn.

cards.name: Endless Inspiration
cards.text:
Whenever a player casts a spell, exile the top card of that player's library. You may play that card for as long as it remains exiled, and you may spend mana as though it was mana of any type to cast it.
At the beginning of your end step, put all cards exiled with Endless Inspiration into their owner's graveyards.

cards.name: Endless Sanctum
cards.text:
Archive 3 (As this enters, shuffle the top three cards of your main library into a new face up library. Sacrifice this after the archived library is empty.)
Whenever you draw a card from the archived library, put the top card of your main library on the bottom of the archived library.
{B}: Exchange a card from the archived library with a card from your hand.

cards.flavor: “Look upon my works.”
cards.name: Endure Ennui
cards.text: Any number of target players mill twice X cards, where X is the number of artifacts and enchantments you control. Then you may cast a nonland card with mana value X or less from a graveyard without paying its mana cost. You can't cast more spells this turn.

cards.name: Entrancing Melody
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Prevent all damage that would be dealt by creatures this turn.
• Harmonize twice. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)

cards.name: Esoteric Herbology
cards.text:
Choose two or four —
• Search your library for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
• Each player mills seven cards.
• You gain 1 life for each land card in your graveyard.
• Conjure a card named Fatigue and put it on top of your library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)

cards.name: Exhausting Failure
cards.text:
Put target spell on top of its owner's library.
Each player conjures a card named Fatigue and puts it on top of their library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)

cards.flavor: “Ah, Ardy. With your spark, Jara and Almgrove will fight tooth and nail to see which gets to accept you into their halls.”
cards.name: Expensive Tutor
cards.text: When Expensive Tutor enters, tap target land. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Extracurricular Studies
cards.text:
When Extracurricular Studies enters, search target opponent's library for a card and exile it. Then that player shuffles.
You may play cards exiled by Extracurricular Studies and you may spend mana as though it was mana of any type to cast them. When you do, return Extracurricular Studies to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Fatigue
cards.text: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: “My boys are dabbling for now, but they have talent if they ever decide to take up bladesinging seriously.”
cards.name: Fencing Tutor
cards.text:
Double strike
When Fencing Tutor enters, create a 0/1 white Soldier creature token with double strike.

cards.flavor: “Welcome to the academy fair, students! Look around, ask questions, and see what school might be in your future!”
cards.name: Festive Servitor
cards.text:
Festive Servitor gets +1/+1 for each color among spells you've cast this turn.
{2}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Finishing Blow
cards.text: Rouse 1. Finishing Blow deals X damage to any target, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control. (Put a +1/+1 counter on a permanent you control. If it isn't a creature, tap it and it becomes a 0/0 creature in addition to its other types.)

changes: 2024-01-02 — Now a Warlock rather than a Witch
cards.flavor: “You know what they say! Crashing is the first step to. Not . . Crashing . . . ​”
cards.name: Flightful Fledgling
cards.text:
Lifelink
Pay 3 life: Flightful Fledgling gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Flourishing Forest

Flourishing Forest enters tapped.
As Flourishing Forest enters, choose a basic land type.
Flourishing Forest is the chosen type in addition to its other types.

cards.name: Flourishing Island

As Flourishing Island enters, choose a basic land type.
Flourishing Island is the chosen type in addition to its other types.

Flourishing Mountain is the chosen type in addition to its other types.

As Flourishing Swamp enters, choose a basic land type.
Flourishing Swamp is the chosen type in addition to its other types.

cards.flavor: “I don't have time for friends.”
cards.name: Focused Apprentice
cards.text:
Sacrifice a creature: Harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Look at the top two cards of your library. Put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest back on top in any order.

cards.name: Freedom of Life
cards.text: Destroy up to one target artifact or enchantment. Rouse 2. (Distribute two +1/+1 counters among permanents you control. If they aren't creatures, tap them and they become 0/0 creatures in addition to their other types.)

cards.name: Friend of Tides
cards.text:
Defender
When Friend of Tides enters, rouse 2. (Distribute two +1/+1 counters among permanents you control. If they aren't creatures, tap them and they become 0/0 creatures in addition to their other types.)

cards.name: Gentle Lullaby
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.
• Harmonize twice. (To harmonize, trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)

cards.name: Gild in Grace
cards.text: Rouse 2, then you gain 1 life for each creature you control. (Distribute two +1/+1 counters among permanents you control. If they aren't creatures, tap them and they become 0/0 creatures in addition to their other types.)

cards.flavor: “I push people beyond what's expected of them. I believe that's an absolute necessity.”
cards.name: Gilded Conductor

rulings.text: Gilded Conductor's restriction refers to the same harmony ability of the same object. You are able to pick the same harmony effect of two copies of a permanent, or pick multiple harmonies from a permanent if it somehow has more than one, such as via merging.
If a player controls multiple Gilded Conductor, their effects stack. You will still be unable to trigger the same harmony multiple times per harmonize.

cards.text:
As you harmonize, you may choose another harmony ability to trigger. (They can't be the same harmony.)
Harmony — Scry 1.

cards.name: Gilded Duo
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a spell, harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Gilded Duo gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Glen Hunter
cards.text:
Hexproof
You may have Glen Hunter assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Glorious Sanctum
cards.text:
Archive 3 (As this enters, shuffle the top three cards of your main library into a new face up library. Sacrifice this after the archived library is empty.)
Whenever you draw a card from the archived library, put the top card of your main library on the bottom of the archived library.
{W}: Exchange a card from the archived library with a card from your hand.

cards.flavor: Only a small portion of Arpechia's staff are dedicated educators. Many are tasked only with making sure the vast nature preserves are safe for visitors without disrupting the natural cycles.
cards.name: Goliath Tamer
cards.text: Spells you cast with mana value 4 or greater cost {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Growth Neverending
cards.text:
For each counter on each permanent you control, you may put another counter of that kind on that permanent.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Harpstring Ranger
cards.text:
Reach
Whenever one or more creatures with flying attack, harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Harpstring Ranger gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Untap it.

cards.name: Humble Archivist
cards.text: When Humble Archivist enters, you may return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand. If you do, conjure a card named Fatigue and put it on top of your library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)

cards.name: Illumination Savant
cards.text:
Whenever Illumination Savant attacks, harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Put a +1/+1 counter on each artifact creature and enchantment creature you control.

cards.name: Invigorating Shaman
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, rouse 1. Then if you control a creature with power 5 or greater, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control. (Put a +1/+1 counter on a permanent you control. If it isn't a creature, tap it and it becomes a 0/0 creature in addition to its other types.)

cards.flavor:
“I'm perfectly willing to hold this class late. Are you?”
— Professor Shayle
cards.name: Irate Retribution
cards.text:
If you've lost life this turn, you may cast this spell as though it had flash.
Irate Retribution deals X damage to each creature and each planeswalker. You gain X life.

cards.flavor: “Despite your lengthy explanation, I still don't find myself caring which of you two started it.”
cards.name: Jara Disciplinarian
cards.text: When Jara Disciplinarian enters, each player sacrifices a creature.

cards.flavor: “If you can't exceed under pressure, then you aren't cut out for Jara. Try your luck somewhere else. Maybe Arpechia will take you.”
cards.name: Jara Favored
cards.text: Jara Favored gets +2/+2 as long as you've lost life this turn.

cards.flavor: “Our regular courses are of course much more rigorous. But for a guest, well, I'd be happy to help.”
cards.name: Jara Tutelage
cards.text: You gain 5 life. Then draw a card if you've lost life this turn.

cards.flavor: But not necessarily your own.
cards.name: Learn Through Error
cards.text:
Once each turn, when a player loses life, you may harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.

cards.name: Lengthy Lecture
cards.text:
Put target creature on the bottom of its owner's library.
Each player conjures a card named Fatigue and puts it on top of their library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)

cards.name: Lift the Tides
cards.text: Rouse 3. Untap target land. It gains flying and haste until end of turn if it's a creature. (Distribute three +1/+1 counters among permanents you control. If they aren't creatures, tap them and they become 0/0 creatures in addition to their other types.)

cards.artist: Monika Palosz, Jelena Kevic-Djurdjevic & Michal Ivan
cards.name: Lightning and Thunder
cards.text:
If you would harmonize while this spell is on the stack, you may instead put three thunder counters on this spell.
Lightning and Thunder deals X damage to any target, where X is 3 plus the number of thunder counters on Lightning and Thunder.

cards.name: Lost Through Dreams
cards.text: Counter target spell. If a noncreature spell is countered this way, conjure a card named Fatigue and put it on top of your library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)

cards.flavor:
“It's a bit of a hike, but I think it'll be worth it.”
— Ardy to Dayang
cards.name: Luminescent Feathrets
cards.text:
When you cast this spell, copy it for each color of mana spent to cast it beyond the first.
Flying

You may cast Oil the Mind from your graveyard.
Target player mills three cards.
If Oil the Mind was cast from your graveyard, conjure a card named Fatigue and put it on top of your library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)

cards.name: Patient Herbology
cards.text:
When Patient Herbology enters, rouse 2. (Distribute two +1/+1 counters among permanents you control. If they aren't creatures, tap them and they become 0/0 creatures in addition to their other types.)
Sacrifice Patient Herbology: Untap target land. You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Peer Review
cards.text: Reveal the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand, then target opponent may have you put the other on the bottom of your library. (Otherwise put it back on top.)

cards.flavor: “I've attended lectures from a dozen professors across all the academies. When it comes to my education, I can accept nothing less than excellence.”
cards.name: Prism Mage
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, you gain 1 life for each of its colors other than white.

cards.flavor: She's always willing to help a struggling student. Right after she marks these tests, organizes her schoolwork, prepares a study session...
cards.name: Professor's Assistant
cards.text: Whenever Professor's Assistant becomes tapped, add {R}. Until end of turn, you don't lose this mana as steps and phases end.

cards.flavor: “Forget the handwriting, I'm not even sure what language this is in.”

cards.text:
Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
Conjure a card named Fatigue and put it on top of your library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)

cards.flavor: “We're never too old to learn something new.”
cards.name: Professor Adelia
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile a card from your hand with a knowledge counter on it. If you do, draw a card. Then you may have Professor Adelia become a copy of any permanent card you own in exile with a knowledge counter on it, except it has this ability.

• Prove Worthy deals 3 damage to target creature or planeswalker.

cards.text:
[+1]: For each player, exile the top three cards of that player's library, then put one of those cards into that player's hand.
[0]: Choose target card exiled by Rahit. Until your next turn, you may play that card, and you may spend mana as though it was mana of any type to cast it.
[-7]: Target player draws seven cards.

cards.name: Recollection Revelation
cards.text:
When Recollection Revelation enters, rouse 1. (Put a +1/+1 counter on a permanent you control. If it isn't a creature, tap it and it becomes a 0/0 creature in addition to its other types.)
{1}{W}, Sacrifice Recollection Revelation: Return another target artifact or enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Revelation Sanctum
cards.text:
Archive 3 (As this enters, shuffle the top three cards of your main library into a new face up library. Sacrifice this after the archived library is empty.)
Whenever you draw a card from the archived library, put the top card of your main library on the bottom of the archived library.
{U}: Exchange a card from the archived library with a card from your hand.

cards.flavor: “You've read the primers, studied the basics, and debated the applications. Now, let's see your execution.”

cards.text: Shuffle your graveyard into your library, then draw two cards.

cards.name: Revisionary Studies
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Exile your library, then shuffle Revisionary Studies, your graveyard, and your hand into your library. Draw five cards.

cards.flavor: Everyone expected him to aim for the illustrious Jara or Almgrove academies, but as Ardy pinched his already red arm to stay awake he found the words on the practice exam swimming before his eyes.
cards.name: Rigorous Concentration
cards.text: Scry 1, then you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.flavor:
“It's a bit like your dolls, right?” Ardy said.
Dayang stifled a laugh. “It's a lot like it's twenty feet tall.”
cards.name: Rousing Roots
cards.text: Rouse 4. (Distribute four +1/+1 counters among permanents you control. If they aren't creatures, tap them and they become 0/0 creatures in addition to their other types.)

cards.name: Scintillating Tome
cards.text:
When Scintillating Tome enters, choose a nonbasic card name.
{T}: Scry 1, then you may reveal the top card of your library. If a card with the chosen name is revealed this way, put it into your hand.

cards.flavor: “She changed schools last semester, but we try to stay in touch.”
cards.name: Sending Stones
cards.text:
When Sending Stones enters, harmonize twice. (To harmonize, trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
If you would harmonize, you may trigger a harmony of a permanent card in your graveyard instead.

cards.name: Senior Warding
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target permanent gains protection from instants and sorceries until end of turn.
• You gain 3 life.
• Draw a card.

cards.name: Sensory Stimulation
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Untap each creature you control.
• Harmonize twice. (To harmonize, trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)

cards.name: Serene Initiate
cards.text:
When Serene Initiate enters, rouse 1. (Put a +1/+1 counter on a permanent you control. If it isn't a creature, tap it and it becomes a 0/0 creature in addition to its other types.)
{3}{G}{G}: Creatures you control get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: “Tonight I shall be far too occupied delving into the dark depths of my grimoire for such trivial activities. But what about tomorrow after lunch?”
cards.name: Shadowed Apostle
cards.text:
Deathtouch
When Shadowed Apostle dies, draw a card.

cards.flavor: “My grades aren't enough to catch the attention of Jara. But. I know they have a soft spot for bladesinging percussionists.”
cards.name: Silkwrap Brawler
cards.text: {2}, Pay 2 life: Silkwrap Brawler gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor: One part performance, one part sport. One part collaboration, one part competition. The art of bladesinging is built on the back of decades of nuance.
cards.name: Sing Through Steel
cards.text: Target creature gains trample and haste until end of turn. Harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)

cards.flavor: “Trust me, you'll never see the academies the same way again.”
cards.name: Skyline Climber
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Skyline Climber attacks, another target creature you control gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“Remember that we have mid term exams tomorrow. I hope you've all been studying.”
— Rahit, arcane tutor
cards.name: Sleepless Studies
cards.text:
Draw two cards.
Conjure a card named Fatigue and put it on top of your library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)

cards.name: Soaring Observatory
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}. If Soaring Observatory entered this turn, add one mana of any color instead.
Tap three differently named untapped Academies you control: Add three mana in any combination of colors.

cards.name: Somnambulance
cards.text:
When Somnambulance enters, each player conjures a card named Fatigue and puts it on top of their library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)
Whenever a player casts a spell named Fatigue, you may draw a card. If you do, you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Specialized Training Dummy
cards.text:
When Specialized Training Dummy enters, choose a card name.
Other creatures you control with the chosen name get +1/+1.

cards.name: Spectacle of Arpechia
cards.text: Rouse 4. Sacrifice a creature at the beginning of the next end step. (Distribute four +1/+1 counters among permanents you control. If they aren't creatures, tap them and they become 0/0 creatures in addition to their other types.)

cards.name: Speed Reader
cards.text:

Harmony — Add {R}{R}.

cards.flavor:
“You've all been practicing your abjuration as instructed, I hope.”
— Professor Shayle
cards.name: Starfall Instructor
cards.text:
Whenever Starfall Instructor attacks, harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Each opponent loses 2 life.

cards.name: Stir the Pot
cards.text:
Choose one or three —
• Target opponent loses 3 life.
• Return target creature card with mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
• Conjure a card named Fatigue and put it on top of your library. (It's a colorless sorcery that costs {2} with “Draw a card.”)

cards.flavor: “Try again.”
cards.name: Strict Instructor
cards.text:
Whenever Strict Instructor attacks, harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Tap or untap another target permanent.

cards.name: Studies Past
cards.text:
If you've lost life this turn, you may cast this spell as though it had flash.
Return X target cards with different mana values from your graveyard to your hand. Put Studies Past on the bottom of its owner's library.

cards.name: Study Sphere
cards.text: Whenever Study Sphere or another artifact or enchantment you control enters, rouse 1. (Put a +1/+1 counter on a permanent you control. If it isn't a creature, tap it and it becomes a 0/0 creature in addition to its other types.)

cards.name: Supernal Icon
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a spell, harmonize. (Trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Target permanent you control becomes a 2/2 creature with flying in addition to its other types until end of turn.

cards.name: Thorn Tender
cards.text: When Thorn Tender enters, rouse 1, then put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control. (Put a +1/+1 counter on a permanent you control. If it isn't a creature, tap it and it becomes a 0/0 creature in addition to its other types.)

cards.name: Training Duel
cards.text: Rouse 2. Target permanent you controls fights target creature you don't control if both are creatures. (Distribute two +1/+1 counters among permanents you control. If they aren't creatures, tap them and they become 0/0 creatures in addition to their other types.)

Enchantment creatures you control get +1/+1 and have lifelink.
Artifact creatures you control get +1/+1 and have flying.

cards.name: Twilight Dancer

Harmony — Each player loses 1 life and mills a card.

cards.name: Updraft Dancer
cards.text:
At the beginning of each combat, harmonize twice. (To harmonize, trigger up to one harmony of a permanent you control.)
Harmony — Target creature gets +1/+1 and your choice of flying, haste, or vigilance until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The wilderness reserves of Arpechia are vast. One can travel for days, and see no sign of civilization beyond the overgrown cobble path beneath their feet.
cards.name: Wander Arpechia
cards.text: Search your library for a Forest or Academy card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
